english: surname Peng; ancient state name; booming (sound); exuberant

etymology.description: 壴 ‘drum’ + 彡 ‘visualization of the sound of drumming’ — sound of drumming.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a drum with marks that depict reverberating sound, evoking booming beats. The sense of loud resonance extended to names, becoming a surname and appearing in toponyms and state names.

examples.chinese: 我认识彭先生(我認識彭先生)。
这座城市古称彭城(這座城市古稱彭城)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò chéngshì gǔ chēng Péngchéng.
examples.english: This city was historically called Pengcheng.

examples.chinese: 史书记载有彭国(史書記載有彭國)。
examples.english: Historical records mention the state of Peng.
